Html:
I'm trying NetOffice and looks really useful. Fact is, I want to use it with SharpDevelop.

Is there any way to create a POwerPoint addin the same way I used to do it in Visual Studio, I mean, with a template?

Thanks for your help.

sorry for the delay, codeplex has issues at the moment. i dont get notifications for new discussions.
you can use the NetOffice Developer Toolbox( n the Download Section)
the toolbox includes an independent project wizard, another good way is to customize the examples.
please note: NetOffice doesnt include visual ui designers in the current release. the next NetOffice does that better and allows rich design time support  to customize the Office UI.

Sebastian

Thanks for the response. Actually I realized that the Developer Toolbox provides a project wizard when you use Visual Basic 2010 Express, so I ditched #develop. And everything seems OK except for 2 issues I'll create threads for. Thanks for your help and for this excellent library.
